channel.title: Abhinav Narne - Writing
channel.description: Articles on AI security, LLM red teaming, and trust & safety by Abhinav Narne.

item.title: Notes on the Claude Code 2.1.0 outage
item.description: A changelog formatting change took down Claude Code. Lessons about parsing human docs as machine data.

item.title: Notes on the Eurostar chatbot "vulnerability" report
item.description: Looking at what makes something a vulnerability versus a hardening opportunity in LLM applications.

item.title: What I learned shipping 1,000+ PRs with Claude Code
item.description: Notes from using Claude Code in parallel git worktrees: Plan Mode, ultrathink, verification loops, and Chrome automation.

item.title: How AI Regulation Changed in 2025
item.description: Why "AI compliance questions" appeared in security questionnaires and RFPs, and how policy becomes contract requirements.

item.title: Why Attack Success Rate (ASR) Isn't Comparable Across Jailbreak Papers
item.description: ASR isn't portable across papers because measurement choices dominate the headline number. Includes math and a checklist for reading papers.

item.title: GPT-5.2 Initial Trust and Safety Assessment
item.description: Day-zero red team of GPT-5.2 focusing on jailbreak resilience and harmful content.

item.title: Real-Time Fact Checking for LLM Outputs
item.description: Introduces search-rubric, an assertion where a search-enabled judge verifies time-sensitive claims during evals and CI.

item.title: When AI becomes the attacker: The rise of AI-orchestrated cyberattacks
item.description: Connects malware querying LLMs at runtime with "vibe hacking" case studies. Defense needs continuous testing.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards Makes Models Faster, Not Smarter
item.description: RLVR gains are often "search compression" rather than new reasoning ability.

item.title: Prompt Injection vs Jailbreaking: What's the Difference?
item.description: Jailbreaking targets model safety training; prompt injection targets application trust boundaries.

item.title: AI Safety vs AI Security in LLM Applications: What Teams Must Know
item.description: Safety protects people from harmful outputs; security protects systems from adversarial manipulation.

item.title: Evaluating political bias in LLMs
item.description: Open methodology and dataset (2,500 political statements) to measure political leaning in models.
